test_questions.explanation: In parallel resonance current is minimum.

test_questions.question: In a minimum function
test_questions.opta: the degree of numerator and denominator are equal
test_questions.optb: the degree of numerator and denominator are unequal
test_questions.optc: the degree of numerator is one more than degree of denominator
test_questions.optd: the degree of numerator is one less than degree of denominator
test_questions.explanation: If degrees of numerator and denominator were unequal, a pole or zero can be removed. Such a function cannot be a minimum function. Therefore degrees of numerator and denominator must be equal.

test_questions.question: When a current source I is suddenly connected across a two terminal relaxed RC circuit at time t = 0, the voltage across the current source is shown in figure. The RC circuit is
test_questions.opta: a series combination of R and C
test_questions.optb: a parallel combination of R and C
test_questions.optc: a series combination of R and parallel combination of R and C
test_questions.explanation: Initially capacitor behaves as short-circuit and finally as open circuit.

test_questions.question: The terms RMS and average values apply only to sine waves.
test_questions.explanation: These terms are applicable to all waveshapes.

test_questions.question: The drift velocity of electrons is
test_questions.opta: very small as compared to speed of light
test_questions.optc: almost equal to speed of light
test_questions.explanation: Drift velocity of electrons is very small.

test_questions.question: Wave A = 100 sin ωt and wave B = 100 cos ωt. Then
test_questions.opta: rms values of the two waves are equal
test_questions.optb: rms values of A is more than that of B
test_questions.optc: rms values of A is less than that of B
test_questions.optd: rms values of the two waves may or may not be equal
test_questions.explanation: Since peak values are equal, their rms values are equal irrespective of phase difference.

test_questions.explanation: Insulation resistance of cable is inversely proportional to length.

test_questions.explanation: A minimum of 2 wattmeters is required to measure 3 phase power. Of course power can be measured by putting one wattmeter in each phase.

test_questions.question: Which of the following is correct for a driving point functions?
test_questions.opta: The real parts of all poles must be negative
test_questions.optb: The real parts of all poles and zeros must be negative
test_questions.optc: The real parts of all poles and zeros must be negative or zero
test_questions.optd: The real parts of all zeros must be negative
test_questions.explanation: It is a necessary condition for response to be stable.

test_questions.question: In an RC series circuit R = 100 Ω and XC = 10 Ω. In this circuit
test_questions.opta: the current and voltage are in phase
test_questions.optb: the current leads the voltage by about 6°
test_questions.optc: the current leads the voltage by about 84°
test_questions.optd: the current lags the voltage by about 6°
test_questions.explanation: In RC circuit the current leads the voltage.

test_questions.question: The impedance of an RC series circuit is 12 Ω at f= 50 Hz. At f= 200 Hz, the impedance will be
test_questions.explanation: Z = R2 + XC2. When f is made four times, XC becomes one-fourth but R remains the same.

test_questions.question: A current is flowing through a conductor with non-uniform area of cross-section. Then
test_questions.opta: current will be different at different cross-sections.
test_questions.optb: current will be the same at all the cross-sections.
test_questions.optc: current will be different but current density will be same at all the cross-sections
test_questions.optd: current will be the same but current density will be different at different cross-sections.
test_questions.explanation:
Current density = current/area of cross-section. Same current throughout the conductor. 
Since, area of cross-section is non-uniform, current density will be different at different cross-sections.

test_questions.optc: both length and diameter of cable
test_questions.explanation: Current rating depends only on area of cross-section and hence diameter.

test_questions.question: In an ac circuit, the maximum and minimum values of power factor can be
test_questions.explanation: Power factor is maximum and equal to 1 for purely resistive load. Power factor is minimum and equal to zero for purely reactive load.
